title: kinjishi_no_shiki
body:
Shiki the Golden Lion (金獅子のシキ, Kinjishi no Shiki?) is an antagonist from [[One Piece]]. He is mentioned briefly in the manga, is a focal point of "chapter 0" and is the main antagonist of the tenth movie. He also appeared briefly in an anime filler episode, one of four made to promote the tenth movie.

He is a notorious pirate who is known to be the first prisoner to have ever escaped Impel Down. He was a pirate that wreaked havoc during Roger's time. His nickname, Kinjishi, means "golden lion". He is also known as the "Flying Pirate".

title: crested_ibis
body:
The crested ibis (Nipponia nippon) is a bird species formerly living all over east Asia, especially Japan, as you can guess from the binomial name. In the last several decades their numbers have been dropping, and they were extinct in the wild in Japan as of 2003.

Crested ibises appear in [[Curiosities of Lotus Asia]], chapter 3 ("Illusionary Bird") as food, and so occasionally show up in [[Touhou]] fanworks. They are associated with [[Tokiko_(touhou)|]], who is mentioned in the previous story in that book; "toki" is the Japanese name for the crested ibis.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Crested ibis":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crested_ibis]

title: spy_(tf2)
body:
[i]Gentlemen?[/i]

One of the playable classes in [[Team Fortress 2]].

A suave, mysterious man from an indeterminate region of France, the Spy is a puzzle wrapped in an enigma shrouded by riddles. An expert in infiltration and professional womanizer, the Spy can [[disguise]] himself as anyone and everyone, and often plays the role of the straightest man amongst the team. Although he acts professional and serious, in-game voice lines reveal his childish, comical side when he dominates enemies. Is known to have had an affair with [[scout (tf2)|the Scout's]] mother, and is all but stated to be his biological father, unbeknownst to the Scout. Often considered the natural enemy of [[Engineer (tf2)|the Engineer]], and has a rivalry of sorts with [[Sniper (tf2)|the Sniper]].

The weakest class in terms of stats, the Spy uses his "invis watch" to become [[invisible]] and sneak behind enemy lines. His disguise kit lets him [[disguise]] as any other class, with fanworks often depicting him disguising as even inanimate objects. Once behind his target, he uses his signature [[balisong]] or other [[knife|knives]] to instantly kill them with a [[backstab]]. He also carries a [[revolver]], and a device called a "sapper" that lets him disable buildings constructed by the Engineer. He has several alternative versions of each weapon, including the "Ambassador" revolver engraved with a pinup of the Scout's mother.

The Spy's default outfit includes a team-colored two-piece [[pinstripe suit]] with a [[necktie]], black [[gloves]] and [[dress shoes]], and [[balaclava]]. He is almost always seen smoking a [[cigarette]], and while disguised, wears a paper [[mask]] with an image of whoever he's disguised as.

title: sniper_(tf2)
body:
[i]Professionals have standards. Be polite. Be efficient. Have a plan to kill everyone you meet.[/i]

One of the playable classes in [[Team Fortress 2]], real name Mr. Mundy.

Raised in the Australian outback, the Sniper prides professionalism over all else. He takes his job as an assassin very seriously, and although he can often be amicable and polite, he considers sociality secondary to cold efficiency. Lives in a camper [[van]], and has questionable hygienic practices. Although he cares for his adoptive parents, they are shown to disagree with his line of work. Supplementary materials would later reveal the Sniper to actually be the child of a crazed scientist couple from the sunken nation of New Zealand, explaining his lanky build compared to real Australians. Shared a gameplay update and plenty of animosity with [[Spy (tf2)|the Spy]].

The primary long-range class of the game, the Sniper's main weapon is a bolt-action [[sniper rifle]] with which he can [[headshot]] most other classes to instantly kill them. He also wields the Huntsman [[bow_(weapon)|bow]], a [[submachine gun]], a [[kukri]], and most infamously [[Jarate]], a "jar-based karate" that consists of throwing jars of his own urine.

The Sniper's default outfit includes a dark [[vest]] over a team-colored shirt, a [[quiver]] on his back, brown [[fingerless gloves]], partially transparent [[sunglasses]], a brown [[hat]], and simple dark pants and brown shoes.

title: scout_(tf2)
body:
[i]Grass grows, birds fly, sun shines, and brotha' - I hurt people.[/i]

One of the playable classes in [[Team Fortress 2]], real name Jeremy.

An overconfident, narcissistic young man from Boston, Massachusetts, who learned to run at breakneck speeds to outspeed his seven older brothers. Takes great pride in his fighting ability, and is shown to have a deep crush on [[Miss Pauling]], though he also occasionally shows flashes of decency.

The fastest playable character, and tied for the lowest health, the Scout's main weapon is his [[scattergun]], a modified [[shotgun]]. He also wields a [[handgun]], an aluminum [[baseball bat]], the "Bonk! Atomic Punch" [[soda can]] that grants him brief invincibility and super speed, and various alternative versions of each.

The Scout's default outfit is a team-colored shirt with a black [[backpack]], a black hat with a yellow [[headset]], knee-length black pants with a belt, [[hand wraps]] and [[dog tags]].

title: demoman_(tf2)
body:
[i]What makes me a good Demoman? If I were a bad Demoman, I wouldn't be sittin' here, discussin' it with you now would I?[/i]

One of the playable classes in [[Team Fortress 2]], real name Tavish Degroot.

A "black Scottish cyclops" hailing from a wealthy clan of demolitionists in Ullapool, Scotland, the Demoman is primarily known for his incredible expertise in [[explosive|explosives]], and his incredible alcoholism. Despite almost always being drunk on the job, he's professional and skilled, though often rowdy and belligerent to his foes. As a child, he lost his eye to an incident involving a wizard and a sentient grimoire of explosives, and in the game's current year he lives with, and dotes on, his blind, job-obsessed mother, where he's shown to be much more personable and friendly while off the clock. Has an on-off friendship with [[Soldier (tf2)|the Soldier]].

In-game, the Demoman has less movement speed and higher health than other classes, and specializes in long-range projectile explosives. His two main weapons are his [[grenade launcher]] and his "stickybomb launcher", which fires remotely-detonated bombs. He also wields his [[bottle]] of scrumpy as a melee weapon. Later game updates would give him the [[Eyelander]], a haunted [[claymore (sword)|]] that now lives with him, as well as a [[buckler]] to allow him to play as a melee class, and various alternative versions of all his weapons.

The Demoman's default outfit includes a black protective chestpiece with six [[grenade|grenades]], a black cap and [[eyepatch]], a full-body team colored undersuit and black [[boots]].

title: soldier_(tf2)
body:
[i]If fighting is sure to result in victory, then you must fight! Sun Tzu said that, and I'd say he knows a little more about fighting than you do, pal, because he invented it![/i]

One of the playable classes in [[Team Fortress 2]], real name Jane Doe.

An authoritative, jingoistic, insane [[military]] man, the Soldier was rejected from every branch of the U.S. Army during World War 2, so he financed his own trip to Poland, killing Nazis by himself until informed of the war's end years prior. Dedicates himself to a bizarre, warped version of American history and excellence, to the point where his multinational teammates simply play along to avoid his ire. Despite being hilariously crazy, he remains an excellent combatant in the field of war.

In game, the Soldier has higher health and slower movement speed than most classes, offset by his ability to rocket jump. His signature weapons are his [[rocket launcher]], his [[shotgun]], and a trench [[shovel]] he wields as a melee weapon, along with a combination [[backpack]] and [[bugle]] he can use to inspire his allies with various buffs, and various alternative versions of each.

By default, the Soldier wears a team colored coat, several military belts, black pants and [[boots]], a [[grenade]] pair on his chest, and a [[helmet]] that often gives him [[covered eyes]].

h4. See also

* [[Rick May]]: Voice actor

title: heavy_(tf2)
body:
[i]Some people think they can outsmart me. Maybe...maybe. I've yet to meet one that can outsmart bullet.[/i]

One of the playable classes in [[Team Fortress 2]]. Full title Heavy Weapons Guy, real name Mikhail, and often considered the "face" of the game as a whole.

An enormous, powerful man hailing from the USSR, the Heavy's family was imprisoned in a gulag when he was young due to the actions of his counter-revolutionary father, leading to him to break out, slaughter the guards, and bring his mother and sisters to a secluded home. Although he may seem like a slow, dim-witted gentle giant, in reality he is sharp-minded in his fluent tongue and generally wishes for people around him to stop talking. He becomes much more energetic when mowing down "tiny baby men", and delights in tearing apart enemies with his enormous miniguns. Said miniguns are one of his greatest obsessions, naming each of them and doting over them affectionately. Both in-game and out, he is often paired with [[Medic (tf2)|the Medic]], and the two are shown to be friends.

The slowest class with the highest health, the Heavy's primary weapon is his [[minigun]], Sasha. He also wields a [[shotgun]], fights with his bare fists for his melee weapons, and carries around the [[Sandvich]], his signature [[sandwich]] that provides healing, as well as various alternative versions of each.

The Heavy's default outfit includes a black [[vest]], a [[bandolier]], a [[bald]] head with [[stubble]], a short-sleeved team-colored undershirt, grey pants with a [[belt]], and simple black [[boots]].

title: lily_black
body:
A fan nickname for a [[alternate color|black-clad]] version of [[Touhou]]'s [[Lily White]], first appearing as a random encounter in [[Phantasmagoria of Flower View]].

[[Doujinshi|Doujins]] vary on her relationship to her canonical counterpart - some depict her as an alternate persona, and others as an entirely different character - but nevertheless she is frequently depicted as a more serious counterpart to the cheerful Lily White.

[[ZUN (artist)|]] eventually confirmed that [[Lily Black]] is just [[Lily White]] dressing like [[Shiki Eiki]]. Given all the other fairies in the stage do the same, it's possible that the outfit is a uniform of sorts.

title: akagami_no_shirayukihime
body:
A 2006-present shoujo manga written by [[Akizuki Sorata]], published by Hakusensha. An anime was green-lit to air for the summer 2015 season.

Wikipedia Summary 
[[Shirayuki (akagami no shirayukihime)|]] is a normal citizen of the kingdom of Tanbarun with one unique feature: her [[red hair]]. When the prince of Tanbarun orders her to become his concubine because of this, she cuts her hair and escapes to the neighboring kingdom of Clarines. On her way there, she meets and befriends Prince [[Zen Wistalia|Zen]] and his two aides. When [[Zen Wistalia|Zen]] is poisoned by an [[apple]] meant for her, [[Shirayuki (akagami no shirayukihime)|]] successfully obtains the antidote and decides to accompany the trio to Clarines. Shortly thereafter, [[Shirayuki (akagami no shirayukihime)|]] passes an exam for a position to train in the palace as a pharmacist. The story follows [[Shirayuki (akagami no shirayukihime)|]]  and her friends as she finds her place in Clarines and carries out her duties as a court pharmacist.

title: megadeth
body:
[b]Megadeth[/b] is an American "thrash metal":[/pools/6818] band from Los Angeles, California. The group was formed in 1983 by guitarist Dave Mustaine and bassist David Ellefson, shortly after Mustaine's dismissal from [[Metallica]]. A pioneer of the American thrash metal scene, the band is credited as one of the genre's "big four" with [[Anthrax (band)|]], Metallica and [[Slayer (band)|]]. title: rugby
body:
A team sport played between two teams of either thirteen players (in rugby league) or fifteen players (in rugby union) using a [[rugby ball|ovoid ball]]. There are quite a number of differences between the two codes of rugby ([1]).

The object of the game is to score by either:

* Touching the ball on the area of the pitch behind the goalposts, thereby scoring a "try" worth either four points (in rugby league) or five points (in rugby union), followed by an attempt of a "conversion", an attempt to send the ball between the goalposts and over the crossbar between them, which is worth two points in both rugby codes.
* Penalty goals, done in a similar fashion to a conversion, worth either three points (in rugby union) or two points (in rugby league).
* Drop goals, worth either three points (in rugby union) or one point (in rugby league).

h4. See also
* [[playing sports]]
* [[tag group:sports]]

h4. External links

* [1] "Wikipedia: Comparison of rugby league and rugby union":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comparison_of_rugby_league_and_rugby_union

title: jackass
body:
Jackass is an American reality slapstick comedy television series created by Johnny Knoxville, Spike Jonze, and Jeff Tremaine, directed by Tremaine, and produced by Dickhouse Productions. It originally aired for three seasons on MTV between October 1, 2000 and February 3, 2002. The show featured a cast of ten carrying out stunts and pranks on each other or the public. The cast included Knoxville, Bam Margera, Steve-O, Chris Pontius, Dave England, Ryan Dunn, Ehren McGhehey, Jason "Wee Man" Acuña, and Preston Lacy.

A tokin is a small [[box]] worn on the foreheads of Yamabushi - practitioners of Shugendō - or [[tengu]], dangerous yet protective spirits of the mountains and forests from the Japanese mythology. It is not only worn as a head decoration, but also used as a drinking [[cup]].

title: kagura_chizuru
body:
A character from SNK's [[The King of Fighters]] series. Sub-boss of [[The King of Fighters '96]] and [[The King of Fighters 2003|2003]] (the latter being alongside [[Kagura Maki|Maki]]) and a playable character in [[The King of Fighters '97|'97]] and [[The King of Fighters '98|'98]].

Like [[Kusanagi Kyou]] and [[Yagami Iori]], she is a member of the clan that holds one of the three sacred artifacts that originally sealed the serpent monster [[Orochi (kof)|Orochi]] 1,800 years ago: the Yata no Kagami or Yata Mirror. Due to the rivals' attribution towards one another, Chizuru is usually the one who has to keep the trio together. They form the Three Sacred Treasures Team whose endings often entail the canon events of any parties involved. 

She fights by summoning copies of herself, controlling them to attack the enemy. With little effort, Chizuru can make the copies attack more than once or create more than one copy.

h4. External links
* " Wikipedia article (JP)":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%A5%9E%E6%A5%BD%E3%81%A1%E3%81%A5%E3%82%8B

title: fuse
body: A potentially ambiguous name that could refer to either an electrical fuse (a sacrificial device to prevent excessive current in a circuit) and a [[explosive|explosives]] fuse.  For tagging purposes this tag refers specifically to the explosive variety of fuse, used to initiate the ignition of explosives and [[fireworks|pyrotechnics]].  In particular this tag especially refers to the burning variety of fuse you would find on consumer fireworks or the stereotypical black spherical old style bomb.  Given their visual similarity, they're occasionally referred to as a "wick" (such as those those used in candles and oil lamps).

title: shutline
body:
Shutline is an ongoing manhwa written and illustrated by Kyou. Released in 2021, it has been published by Lezhin.

Shin is barely making ends meet, hustling as a rogue mechanic on the mean city streets. Problem is, work never comes easy and the dough is nothing to shout about. But when Jake pulls up with car trouble one day, it’s obvious that there’s money to be made: he’s tall, blond and dressed like a million bucks. Jackpot. And after such a handsome payday, Shin is reluctant to let this sucker go. Little does he know that giving Jake his number may be the biggest mistake he’s ever made. And it isn’t long before Jake wants more than his car fixing…

title: ural-375
body:
A general purpose 4.5 ton 6×6 [b][[truck]][/b] of [[Soviet]] origin, which has been produced at the "Ural Automotive Plant":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ural_Automotive_Plant] in the [[Russia]] since 1961. The Ural-375 replaced the ZIL-157 as the standard [[Soviet Army]] truck in 1979. Most notable uses of Ural-375 are as a platform for the [b][[BM-21]][/b] Grad [[rocket launcher]], and as a [[soldier|personnel]] or supply carrier. Ural-375D, is the most produced variant, and it has a proper all-steel cabin.

title: chuubyou_gekihatsu_boy
body: Outburst Dreamer Boys (厨病激発ボーイ, Chūbyō Gekihatsu Bōi), also known as Young Disease Outburst Boy, is a Japanese mixed-media project. It started as a Vocaloid song series created by Rerulili. The light novel adaptations are written by Rerulili and Minato Tonami, with illustrations by Hoshima, MW, Koji Milk and Akira Ookami, and published by Kadokawa Shoten under their Kadokawa Beans Bunko label. A manga adaptation with illustrations by Megumi Hazuki was serialized in Shueisha's Ribon Special magazine from July 15, 2016, to December 15, 2016, and compiled into a single tankōbon volume. A 11-episode anime television series adaptation aired between October 4, 2019, and December 13, 2019.

title: bm-21
body:
The [b]BM-21 "Grad"[/b] is a self-propelled 122 mm multiple [b][[rocket launcher]][/b] designed in the [[Soviet]] Union. The system and the M-21OF rocket were first developed in the early [[1960s (style)|1960s]], and saw their first combat use in March 1969 during the Sino-Soviet border conflict. BM stands for [[Russian text|Russian]] phrase [b]боевая машина[/b] [Boyevaya mashina] ([[military vehicle|combat vehicle]]), and the nickname "Grad" means "hail".

In NATO countries, the complete system was initially known as the M1964. The M-21 field rocket system with a BM-21 launch vehicle (122 mm multiple rocket launcher (MRL) system) entered service with the [[Soviet Army]] in 1963. The launch [[ground vehicle|vehicle]] consists of a [b][[Ural-375]]D 6×6 [[truck]][/b] chassis fitted with a bank of rectangularly arranged 40 launch tubes that can be turned away from the unprotected cab.

h1. See also
* [[list of ground vehicles]]
* [[list of weapons]]
* [[missile]]
* Wikipedia entry: "BM-21 Grad":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BM-21_Grad]
other_names: BM-21グラド自走多連装ロケット・システム

title: rpk-16
body:
The [b]RPK-16[/b] is a [[Russia]]n squad automatic weapon/[b][[light machine gun]][/b] chambered in 5.45×39mm, first developed in 2016. It features the famous [[kalashnikov rifle|AK]] gas-operated long-stroke piston system, and shares several novel features derived from the [[AK-12]]. Such as a Picatinny rails, detachable [[bipod]] instead of the fixed one of the [[RPK-74]] and a side-[[folding stock]]

The RPK-16 wo main barrel lengths; a 550 mm long barrel for [[light machine gun|LMG]] role and a 370 mm one  for [[assault rifle]] role. Its design enables it to have an interchangeable barrels that can easily be removed, and the ability to quickly attach a [[suppressor]]. It primarily uses a 95-round [[drum magazine]] and also compatible with standard [[magazine (weapon)|magazines]] from earlier [[AK-74]], AK-12 and RPK-74.

h4. See also
* [[list of weapons]]
* [b][[RPK]][/b]
* [[RPK-16 (Girls' Frontline)]]
* Wikipedia entry: "RPK#RPK-16":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RPK#RPK-16]

title: rpk-74
body:
The RPK-74 is a [[Soviet]] 5.45×39mm [b][[light machine gun]][/b] introduced in 1974, based on [[AK-74]] [[assault rifle]]. The [[weapon]] features longer barrel, a [[bipod]], slightly longer receiver in order to enhance its sustained fire capability. It feeds from a standard 45-round [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]], interchangeable with the rifle counterpart.

h6. Variants
* [b]RPKS-74[/b] - Has a solid wooden side-[[folding stock]]. Unlike the [[AKS-74]] with triangular metal one.

title: grappling_hook
body:
Any kind of rope that can latch on or attach to a target, allowing the the user to:

* hang from the target or follow it
* pull themselves towards the object
* pull the object towards the themselves, like a frog's tongue

Usually has large claws or hooks on the end to grab to the top edge of a ledge or wall, like an anchor. 

In fantasy, they're the tools of assassins, spies, mercenaries, high-tech robots, and the military. They're often powered by gas, electricity, motors, magnets, and magic to pierce throw or really stick themselves to just about any target, even a flat wall and the heaviest of loose objects.

This tag is automatically added to posts for sites that Danbooru recognizes, and cannot be removed from those posts. It can be freely added or removed to posts for sites Danbooru doesn't recognize.

h4. See also

* [[bad link]], where the source is correct but leads to a direct image instead of the post

title: bust_(sculpture)
body: A bust is a [[statue|sculpted]] or cast representation of the [[upper body]], depicting a person's head and neck, and a variable portion of the chest and shoulders without arms. The piece is normally supported by a plinth. The bust is generally a [[portrait]] intended to record the appearance of an individual, but may sometimes represent a type. Busts are made from various materials, such as [[marble (stone)|marble]], bronze, terracotta, plaster, [[wax]] or wood.

title: chocomimi
body: ChocoMimi (チョコミミ, Chokomimi') is a shōjo 4-panel manga series written and illustrated by Konami Sonoda. title: dp-27
body:
[[russian text|Russian:]] [b]Пулемёт Дегтярёвa Пехотный[/b] "Degtyaryov's infantry [[machine gun]]"

The [B]DP-27[/B] or [b]Degtyaryov machine gun[/b] (DP) a [[Soviet]] [b][[light machine gun]][/b] that fires 7.62×54mmR [[ammunition|cartridge]], designed by "Vasily Degtyaryov":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vasily_Degtyaryov]. Service trials starting in 1927, followed by general deployment in 1928. It is the standard [[soviet army|Soviet infantry]] LMG during [[World War II]]. With various modifications it was used in [[aircraft]] and almost all Soviet [[tank]]s as either a flexible bow machine gun or a co-axial one  controlled by the gunner. It was improved in 1943 into the DPM, then replaced in 1946 with the belt-fed RP-46.

The most iconic feature of DP-27 is its standard 47-round pan [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]]. So it was nicknamed the "[[phonograph|record player]]". Speaking of pop culture depiction, it is the signature [[weapon]] of [[Tachanka (rainbow six siege)|Tachanka]] from [[Rainbow Six Siege]] and a popular [[gun]] in [[Playerunknown's_battlegrounds|PUBG]].

h1. See also
* [[DP28 (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[DShK]]
* [[list of weapons]]
* [[PTRD-41]]
* [[PPD-40]]
* [[RPD]]
* Wikipedia entry: "Degtyaryov machine gun":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Degtyaryov_machine_gun

title: spas-15
body:
The Franchi SPAS-15 is a dual-mode 12 gauge [b][[combat shotgun]][/b] manufactured by the Italian company "Luigi Franchi S.P.A.":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franchi_(firearms)] It is based on the more popular [[SPAS-12]], and has similar [[pump action|pump-action]]/semi-automatic firing modes. In semi-automatic mode, a gas piston drives a bolt carrier and rotating bolt. In pump-action mode, the same components are driven by sliding the fore-end backwards. Pump-action mode is required to reliably fire low-pressure (less lethal) [[shotgun shell|ammunition]] such as [[tear gas]] rounds or less-lethal bean bags. 

Unlike its predecessor, the SPAS-15 is fed by a detachable box [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]]. The gun features either a fixed black wooden stock, or a side [[folding stock|folding metal stock]], and a carry [[handle]].

h1. See also
* [[list of weapons]]
* [[SPAS-15 (Girls' Frontline)]]
* Wikipedia entry: "Franchi SPAS-15":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franchi_SPAS-15]

title: bmpt_terminator
body:
The [b]BMPT "Terminator"[/b] (Боевая машина поддержки танков - Tank Support Fighting Vehicle) is an [[armored vehicle|armored fighting vehicle]], designed and manufactured by "Uralvagonzavod":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uralvagonzavod]. This vehicle was designed for supporting tanks  in urban areas. The BMPT is unofficially named the "Terminator" by the manufacturers. It is heavily armed and armored to survive in urban combat. Armed with four 9M120 Ataka [[missile launcher]]s, two 30 mm 2A42 [[autocannon]]s, two AG-17D grenade launchers, and one coaxial 7.62 mm [[pk machine gun|PKTM]] [[machine gun]].

The BMPT is built on the chassis of the widely used [[T-72]] tank. The BMPT was designed based on combat experience gained during the [[war in afghanistan|Soviet–Afghan War]] and the First Chechen War. 

h1. See also
* [[list of ground vehicles]]
* [[military vehicle]]
* Wikipedia entry: "BMPT Terminator":[https://id.wikipedia.org/wiki/BMPT_Terminator]

title: uaz-452
body:
The [b]UAZ-452[/b] "Bukhanka" (bread loaf) are a family of compact [[Soviet]]/Russian cab over engine [[van]]s and light [[truck]]s with standard four-wheel drive, off-road capability, built by the "Ulyanovsk Automobile Plant":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UAZ] since 1965. The vans got their nickname due to their outer resemblance to a [[loaf of bread]] – except the [[ambulance]] version, which gets called a "Tabletka" ('Таблетка'), or '[[pill]]' in [[russian text|Russian]].

Since 1985, the vans received updates: more modern engines and internationally compliant lighting, as well as new model numbers, 3741 for the standard van, while (crew-cab) trucks mostly starting with 3303, often with one or two extra digits specifying the version. From 1997, bigger 33036 truck variants with a 25 cm longer wheelbase, and taller soft-top roof bows and drop-sides were added.

h1. See also
* [[list of ground vehicles]]
* Wikipedia entry: "UAZ-452":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UAZ-452]

title: toz-34
body:
TOZ-34 is an over-and-under [b][[double-barreled shotgun]][/b] of [[Soviet]] origin. Available in various gauges, it is produced and manufactured by "Tula Arms Plant":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tula_Arms_Plant] since 1964. TOZ is the acronym of the Russian name of its manufacturer, Тульский оружейный завод (Tulsky oruzheiny zavod). It is a common civilian hunting [[weapon]] in [[Russia]] and several ex-Soviet countries.

TOZ-34 is a hammerless smoothbore [[shotgun]]. The barrels are chrome-plated and have chokes at the muzzle end. It comes with a walnut, birch or beech buttstock and fore-end. In 1965, the shotgun was awarded the golden medal of the Leipzig Trade Fair. In 1970, TOZ-34 received the "State quality mark of the USSR":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/State_quality_mark_of_the_USSR].

h4. See also
* [[list of weapons]]
* Wikipedia entry: "TOZ-34":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TOZ-34]

title: fn-49
body:
The [i]Fabrique Nationale Model 1949[/i] (often referred to as the [b]FN-49[/b]) is a Belgian [b]self-loading rifle[/b] that was designed by  "Dieudonné Saive":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dieudonné_Saive] in 1947. The selective fire version produced for [[Belgium]] was known as the AFN. It was available in various calibers, mainly 7.62mm NATO and .30-06 Springfield. 

While well regarded for its high build quality and reliability in comparison to the rifles of the time, its marketability was limited, as it was not developed in time for use in [[World War II]] but later, as many militaries had already begun the switch to selective fire [[battle rifles]]. An unknown number of FN-49s were produced as selective fire automatic rifles, but the small 10 round box [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]] limited the usefulness of the fully automatic feature.

The FN-49 found itself in direct competition with a number of more modern rifles such as the Heckler & Koch G3 and [[FN Herstal]]'s own [[FN FAL]], resulting in limited sales.

h1. See also
* [[FN-49 (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[list of weapons]]
* Wikipedia entry: "FN Model 1949":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FN_Model_1949]

title: ithaca_m37
body:
The Ithaca 37 bottomloading pump shotgun is easily one of the most well liked and successful shotgun designs ever conceived. A thoroughbred gun, it came from the consolidation of patents and revisions attributed to legendary firearms designers John Browning and John Pedersen. The Ithaca combined a clever and unique design with good manufacturing, sturdy materials and of course, good timing to become a roaring success- indeed, so successful, it made all other Ithaca Gun Company products irrelevant, and the weapon is known only as "Ithaca" (the company only sells one product that isn't a 37 derivative).

The Ithaca 37's main "gimmick" is it's loading and ejection *port*. Not "ports", just port. It only has one. Shells are loaded and ejected from the bottom of the receiver during a normal pump stroke. This clever design lends the 37 a number of advantages; for one, it's friendly to both left and right hand shooters. It is simple to mount a scope on; dirt and other potential hazards only have one possible point of entry. It also looks cool, which paired with the gun's excellent manufacturing quality means it's been in a huge number of movies; from Terminator to Aliens to The Thing and Death Wish, the Ithaca is a regular in cinema and probably always will be.

title: tsubaki_kento
body:
A character from [[Dankira!!!]]. 

A short-tempered person who hates losing, he is the type of person that acts before he thinks. 3rd year’s Seito Tsubaki’s younger brother. He looks up to Ginko, and argues with Rentaro (nicknamed “Ginko’s right hand man”) daily. He loves manga, and always believes that scenarios that happen in manga will happen to him some day.

title: habashiri_ginko
body:
A character from [[Dankira!!!]]. 

Leader of the dancer alliance “Black Meteor.” He subdues others with his sharp gaze, known and feared as “the most daunting.” He stopped fighting when he graduated from middle school. Though he is tough and speaks with his actions, he is passionate during Dankira. He likes watching stars on his motorbike with his close friend Vega, a Fennec fox.

title: atago_rentaro
body:
A character from [[Dankira!!!]]. 

He usually seems like a plain and apathetic gamer. While riding a hoverboard he made with his grandfather (an inventor), he learned how to balance. He lost his place in his ‘home’ after his grandfather’s death, and ran away from home...... but he met Ginko, and joined Black Meteor. He tends to get too involved in games and forgets to eat.

title: busujima_tsukumo
body:
A character from [[Dankira!!!]]. 

Tsukumo is a wild model who is hot-blooded and known for his violent character that destroys everything. He earnestly wants to become strong so he does muscle training every day. His powerful dancing is joked to be a disaster level. He likes protein, but his stomach is weak against milk so he drinks water instead.

title: kurenai_ageha
body:
A character from [[Dankira!!!]]. 

Devilish model Ageha believes that beauty is not related to being male or female. Ageha is acknowledged by the public as a charisma model with androgynous features and unique sensitivity. They work under Shiki. With tall height and long legs, Ageha's body has wide flexibility that allows them to make splendid poses.

title: kiriyama_oboro
body:
A character from [[Dankira!!!]]. 

Oboro is a young man who has a negative outlook, weak mentality, and gets frustrated easily. He does well in acrobatics and parkour. While he is also a student of Minamoto Kakushin-ryu, he has been friends with Mitsukuni since they were kids. He idolizes Mitsukuni who saved him from bullies a long time ago.

title: minamoto_mitsukuni
body:
A character from [[Dankira!!!]]. 

Mustukuni is a young man who possesses intense willpower to never give up, in fact, he is strong enough to become an assistant instructor at the Minamoto Kakushin-ryu dojo. Every day he always works hard in training with Oboro and Yukari. The weapons for his powerful dances are his endless stamina and agility.

title: wakakusa_yukari
body:
A character from [[Dankira!!!]]. 

From a family of poem reciters, he is a courteous, honest, and firm-mannered student of the Minamoto Kakushin martial arts. Called a sound genius that comes only in a thousand years. He also does composing, lyrics, writing, and singing. He longs to have a muscular body that is the opposite of his own.

title: gekkoin_noel
body:
A character from [[Dankira!!!]].

Noel is a descendant of an aristocrat from Britain and lived with his grandmother until his elementary school days. From his looks, he looks like a boy with high morals but actually he is a very foul-mouthed tyrant. He possesses high technique and angel like-grace in dancing, and reigns top in school with a strength that overwhelms everyone.

title: hinata_mahiru
body:
A character from [[Dankira!!!]].

Out of the three of his team, Mahiru spent the longest time at Sheep Manor. A capricious conman. He likes using SNS, taking selfies and photos of nail art and uploading them. With his flexible body and powerful gaze that seems to suck anyone in, he dances with great expressiveness.

title: yano_reiji
body:
A character from [[Dankira!!!]].

Reiji lost his family when he was in grade school and came to live in Sheep Manor. He is strict on both himself and other people, but on the other hand he is good at housework and is very caring. He is a technician who is good at highly complex dances by balancing precision and mobility.

title: asahi_sora
body:
A character from [[Dankira!!!]].

Sora lived his entire life as an orphan, he is a young man who earnestly shows brightness and rich expression in his dances. Before ending up in Sheep Manor, he was part of an entertainer troupe and is very agile and nimble. For some reason, he captures the audience with his simple form while dancing.

title: janome_shiki
body:
A character from [[Dankira!!!]].

Shiki is a fashion designer who deals with haute couture and established the high-class fashion brand Jörmungandr. He is also active in performing arts and amuses hiself with saying extreme ideas and statements to arouse the public. He is currently spreading propaganda through Dankira. He is strangely attached to Sora who he met in school.

title: miki_nozomu
body:
A character from [[Dankira!!!]].

Theater Bell's stylish member, Nozomu finishes up any dance in a fashionably good taste. He is popular in the school as a bright, energetic guy who spends his time partying, He likes dressing up in style with the latest fashion trends and has a temperament of a youngest child. Naturally he is popular with women.

title: yagami_soma
body:
A character from [[Dankira!!!]].

The one in charge of sexiness in Theater Bell, Soma is sometimes kind of pushy and behaves as if he's toying with his opponent. He gives off pheromones the scent of fruit and instantly captivates women. He is a lady-killer who fascinates with lascivious dance.

title: tsubaki_seito
body:
A character from [[Dankira!!!]].

The smart one in Theater Bell, Seito has a lot of composure and excels at dance that show calm maturity. A detached good-looking man, he is hard to comprehend. He has no sense of direction and gets lost often in the school- sometimes even coming into other people's rooms as he pleases. He is also the dormitory head of Goldheim dorm.

title: kagemiya_kei
body:
A character from [[Dankira!!!]].

Born at the nursery at Benizuru Academy, Kei is inseparable from Akira. He is a "thoroughbred" who inherited his intellect from his father who is a high goverment official and his dance skills from his mother who was once a member of a music troupe. He is very fastidious and even now, takes time getting used to living with others. In Dankira and even in private, he prefers to make the first move.

title: shido_akira
body:
A character from [[Dankira!!!]].

Born in a nursery at Benizuru Academy, Akira is Kei's childhood friend and (self proclaimed) best friend. He is the son of the Shidou group that manages the major cosmetic company, Cosmetic Shido. He has absolute confidence in his own beauty. He aims to make people see beautiful flowers in every moment of his dance.

title: stf
body:
A [[wrestling]] hold innovated by the late wrestling legend Lou Thesz. Its full name is [i]Stepover Toehold Facelock[/i] and popularized by retired Japanese wrestler Chono Masahiro (who was Thesz' protégé) and [[WWE]] wrestler [[John Cena]]. 

This [[submission hold]] is performed on an opponent who is lying face down on the mat. The wrestler grabs one of the opponent's legs and places the opponent's ankle between their thighs. The wrestler then lies on top of the opponent's back and locks their arms around the opponent's head. The wrestler then pulls back, stretching the opponent's back, neck, and knee.

There is also an arm-trap, cross-legged variation of this move that was innovated by retired wrestler William Regal which he calls the [i]Regal Stretch[/i], and is currently used by one of his protégés, [[All Elite Wrestling]] wrestler [[Daniel Bryan|Bryan Danielson]]. Danielson's fellow All Elite Wrestling wrestler "Jungle Boy" Jack Perry also uses a cross-legged STF that he calls the [I]Snare Trap[/I].

title: saitou_(gits)
body:
[b]Saitou[/b] is a secondary character in the [[Ghost in the Shell]] series.

An operative of Public Security Section 9's anti-terrorist unit, Saitou is their resident sniper. He has a prosthetic eye—called the "Hawkeye"—that connects to orbiting satellites to improve his accuracy.

Saitou has black hair in a buzz cut, and his left eye is covered by a cybernetic [[eyepatch|patch]].

title: boma_(gits)
body:
[b]Boma[/b] (ボーマ) is a secondary character in the [[Ghost in the Shell]] series.

Boma is a field operative of Public Security Section 9's anti-terrorist unit. He is their resident explosives specialist, and is often seen carrying heavy weaponry. Almost no information is given about his past, other than he was in the JSDF.

Boma is a large, bald man with red optical implants instead of eyes.

title: thermae_romae
body: A manga about [[lucius_modestus|a architect]] who repeatedly gets isekai'd from an ancient Roman bathhouse to a modern Japan [[onsen]].

title: ishikawa_(gits)
body:
[b]Ishikawa[/b] (イシカワ) is a secondary character in the [[Ghost in the Shell]] series.

An experienced hacker, Ishikawa is Public Security Section 9's technological specialist. He served in the military with [[Kusanagi Motoko]] and [[Batou (gits)|]], and appears to be ranked just below them as third-in-command of their unit.

He is an older man of average height, with graying hair and a full beard.

title: batou_(gits)
body:
[b]Batou[/b] (バトー) is one of the main characters from [[Ghost in the Shell]].

Batou is the partner of and apparent second-in-command to Major [[Kusanagi Motoko]] of Public Security Section 9's counter-terrorist unit. He is also often paired with [[Togusa (gits)|]], acting as a mentor to the younger operative.

An ex-Ranger, he is a large, muscular [[cyborg]] with mechanical eyes; he has gray hair tied into a ponytail.

Batou's eye implants were inspired by the character of [[Molly Millions]] from the 80s [[cyberpunk]] novel [[Neuromancer]].

title: togusa_(gits)
body:
[b]Togusa[/b] (トグサ) is a main character in the [[Ghost in the Shell]] series.

Recruited by Major [[Kusanagi Motoko|Kusanagi]] to Public Security Section 9's anti-terrorist unit, Togusa is an ex-police detective. He is unique to the unit in that he's undergone minimal cybernization. Throughout the series, he has used his skills and experience as a detective quite extensively, proving his worth to the team.

Togusa is a man of average height, with brown hair in a [[mullet]] hairstyle.

title: paz_(gits)
body:
[b]Paz[/b] (パズ) is a secondary character in the [[Ghost in the Shell]] series.

Paz is a field operative in Public Security Section 9's anti-terrorist unit. He is labeled a "Jack-of-all-trades" in S.A.C., and his expertise appears to be in close quarters combat, particularly with bladed instruments. Little is known about his personality or past.

Paz is a tall man with slicked-back brown hair and squinted eyes.

A playable character from [[Fire Emblem: The Binding Blade]], Wolt is [[Roy (Fire Emblem)|]]’s childhood friend and sworn retainer, and the son of [[Rebecca (fire emblem)|]] from [[Fire Emblem: The Blazing Blade]]. He has [[Marcus (fire emblem)|]] as a superior, and can befriend [[Alen (fire emblem)|]], [[Lance (Fire emblem)|]], and [[Sue (Fire Emblem)|]] via supports.

Wolt bears a strong resemblance to [[Gordin (Fire Emblem)|]] from [[Fire Emblem: Mystery of The Emblem]], having messy [[green hair]], and wearing a [[purple shirt]]  with [[white pants]] and brown [[boots]]. May be depicted wielding a [[bow (weapon)|]], his weapon of choice.

title: death_(discworld)
body:
The [[death (entity)|personification of Death]], as portrayed in the [[Discworld]] novels. He appears very frequently as a side character across the entire series, and as a main character in several books.

Visually, he differs little from traditional Western depictions of Death, being a skeletal figure clad in a black robe and bearing a scythe.  Besides appearing alongside other Discworld characters or [[Terry Pratchett]], he may be distinguished from a generic personification by his dialogue, which is represented in unquoted "small caps.":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Small_caps

title: bank_vault
body: A [b]bank vault[/b] is a secure space where [[money]], valuables, records, and documents are stored. It is intended to protect their contents from [[theft]], unauthorized access, [[fire]], natural disasters, and other threats, much like a safe. Unlike [[safe_(container) |safes]] however, vaults are an integral part of the [[building]] within which they are built, using armored and/or reinforced walls and a tightly fashioned metal [[door]] closed with a complex [[lock]].

title: log_horizon
body:
A light novel series by [[Touno Mamare]] that was initially posted on Shousetsuka ni Narou in 2010 and has been published by Enterbrain since March 2011. Illustrated by [[Hara Kazuhiro]].

The series follows the Enchanter [[Shiroe (log horizon)|]] and the other players of the long-lived MMORPG Elder Tales after they found themselves whisked away to a fantasy world identical to the game. The light novel received four manga adaptations, with one based on the main story itself and the other three revolving around other important characters in the series. The first season of the anime adaptation started in October 2013.

title: rafinha_bilford
body:
Female character from the series [[Eiyuuou bu wo Kiwameru Tame Tenseisu: Soshite Sekai Saikyou no Minarai Kishi|Eiyuu-ou bu wo Kiwameru Tame Tensei su ~Soshite Sekai Saikyou no Minarai Kishi ♀~]] (English title: Reborn to Master the Blade: From Hero-King to Extraordinary Squire ♀).

Rafinha Bilford, nicknamed Rani (ラニ Rani), is a young lady with [[brown eyes]] and shoulder-length [[black hair]]. She is childhood friends and first cousin to the protagonist, [[Inglis Eucus]].  At the baptismal ceremony she obtained the upper-class grade Bow of Light rune, which appears as a bow-shaped magic rune on the back of her right hand.  She applies to the their Kingdom's Royal Knights' Academy as a knight-in-training with Inglis as her squire.

Rafinha and Inglis, like their mothers, are very big eaters.

title: mori_(blame!)
body: In Chapter 56 of [[Blame!]], [[Killy]] discovers a human corpse whose personality had been recorded onto a white rectangular memory unit with the brand name "Mori", worn on a necklace. The personality recording had become corrupted so she didn't remember her original name. "Fort of Silicon Creatures", a bonus manga chapter packaged with the [i]Blame![/i] Blu-ray, depicts Mori transferring her mind into a prosthetic body that looks almost the same as [[Cibo]], except for a [[mole under eye|mole under her eye]]. In Chapter 64, a black-haired woman wearing a hooded robe comes to live in a virtual world generated by the Netsphere, but it is unclear whether this is Mori's true appearance, or if she is a composite of Mori, Cibo and [[Sanakan]].

title: the_legend_of_zelda:_skyward_sword
body:
Sixteenth entry in the [[The Legend of Zelda]] series.

The game's storyline is the earliest in Zelda continuity, preceding The [[the_legend_of_zelda:_the_minish_cap|Minish Cap]]. Skyward Sword follows an incarnation of the series protagonist [[Link]] who was raised in a society above the clouds known as Skyloft. After his closest childhood friend, [[princess zelda|Zelda]], is swept into the land below the clouds by demonic forces, Link does whatever it takes to save her, traveling between Skyloft and the surface below while battling the dark forces of the self-proclaimed "Demon Lord", [[Ghirahim]].

title: guyrys
body:
GuyRyS is a [[stick_figure|stick figure]] drawn by [[irys_(hololive)|IRyS]].  He was first used in her now unarchived Valentine's Day driving karaoke stream ("caraoke") as a driver/date and frequently appearing in other streams such as serving as background dancers in her first anniversary stream.  According to IRyS, this is her image of her fanbase - the IRyStocrats - though any official adoption was never confirmed.

GuyRyS's body befits a stick figure, being only lines connected in humanoid shape. His head and occasionally his hands are white round solids.  He perpetually smiles and wears a white [[baseball_cap|cap]].  The brim of the cap is the one part of the figure that IRyS said should be important to depict.  When he does speak on stream, his lines are voiced by IRyS using her "GoXLR":https://www.tc-helicon.com/product.html?modelCode=P0CQK.

Unrelated to him, there is also a "Bad GuyRyS" who looks different only by a few strands of stick figure hair that emerge from the top of his cap.

title: yahari_ore_no_seishun_lovecome_wa_machigatteiru.
body:
[b]Yahari Ore no Seishun LoveCome wa Machigatteiru.[/b] (やはり俺の青春ラブコメはまちがっている。, abbrev. [i]OreGairu[/i] or [i]Hamachi[/i]) is a Japanese light novel series written by Watari Wataru and illustrated by [[Ponkan 8]]. It is published by Shogakukan under the Gagaga Bunko imprint and spans 10 volumes, released between March 2011 and November 2014 and three short story collection volumes.

Additionally, the series has received three manga series adaptations and two manga anthology volumes. The artists of the manga series are:
* [[Kazuki Rechi]] - [i]Yahari Ore no Seishun Lovecome wa machigatteiru. -Monologue-[/i] (やはり俺の青春ラブコメはまちがっている。-妄言録-),
* [[Io Naomichi]] - [i]Yahari Ore no Seishun Lovecome wa machigatteiru. @comic [/i] (やはり俺の青春ラブコメはまちがっている。@comic),
* [[Taneda Yuuta]] - [i]Yahari 4koma demo Ore no Seishun Lovecome wa machigatteiru.[/i] (やはり4コマでも俺の青春ラブコメはまちがっている。).

An anime television series, produced by Brain's Base, aired between April 5 and June 28, 2013, a second and third season, produced by feel. titled [i]Yahari Ore no Seishun Lovecome wa machigatteiru. Zoku[/i] (やはり俺の青春ラブコメはまちがっている。続), premiered on April 2, 2015, and [i]Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Comedy wa Machigatteiru. Kan[/i] ( やはり俺の青春ラブコメはまちがっている。完), premiered on Jul 10, 2020. All seasons were licensed in North America by Sentai Filmworks under the titles [i]My Teen Romantic Comedy SNAFU[/i], [i]My Teen Romantic Comedy SNAFU TOO![/i], and [i]My Teen Romantic Comedy SNAFU Climax![/i].

A video game, titled [i]Yahari Game demo Ore no Seishun Rabu Kome wa Machigatteiru.[/i] and published by 5pb., for the PlayStation Vita was released on September 19, 2013.

title: bengoshi_to_17-sai
body:
[i]Bengoshi to 17-Sai[/i] (Lawyer and Seventeen) is a shoujo/josei manga series created by [[Ono Anbi]], initially published on December 2019 by Kodansha.

h6. Synopsis
17-year-old highschool student [[rise (bengoshi to 17-sai)|Rise (理瀬)]] is going out with her childhood friend [[hiroomi (bengoshi to 17-sai)|Hiroomi (博臣)]], a young lawyer. Because of the age gap, [spoiler]Hiroomi imposes the condition that they do not have sexual contact until her graduation, however, Rise doesn't want to wait until then...[/spoiler]

h4. External links
* "Kodansha official website entry":[https://kc.kodansha.co.jp/title?code=1000035422]
* MyAnimeList entry: "弁護士と17歳":[https://myanimelist.net/manga/126780/Bengoshi_to_17-sai]

title: asahi_breweries
body:
The largest of the four major brands of beer in Japan (the others being [[kirin_(company)|Kirin]], [[sapporo_beer|Sapporo]], and [[Suntory]]).

They are most well known for [i]Asahi Super Dry[/i] (アサヒスーパードライ, often shortened to スーパードライ), a beer that transformed the Japanese beer industry when it released in 1987. This beer often comes in either a [[beer bottle|bottle]] or [[beer can|can]] with a silver label on it with Asahi's signature stylized logo.

h4. See also

* [[beer]]

title: ashita_no_nadja
body:
(lit. [i]Tomorrow's Nadja[/i]) is a 50 episode romance anime series produced by Toei Animation, which premiered in Japan on the anime satellite television network Animax and the terrestrial TV Asahi network, between February 2, 2003, and January 25, 2004. A manga version was also made, written by Toudou Izumi (house name for the staff of Toei Animation) and drawn by Ayumi Yui. It was serialized by Kodansha in the manga magazine Nakayoshi and collected in two bound volumes.

h4. Characters

* [[Nadja Applefield]]
* [[Rosemary Applefield]]
* [[Kennosuke Tsurugi]]

title: ray_(mospeada)
body:
One of the main characters from the [[Kikou Souseiki Mospeada]] [[mecha]] anime series from the 1980s.

[b]Ray[/b] is a 17-year-old Earth human rebel who fights against the [[Inbit]]. He is a good motorcycle rider. Ray used to be a desert scavenger. He is now the historian, optimist, and wisecracker of [[Stick Bernard]]'s guerilla fighter squad. 

Ray's mecha of choice is a green [i]VR-052T Battler[/i] [[mospeada_(mecha)|Mospeada]] variable [[motorcycle]], which carries a high-capacity beam pistol. Stick taught him how to use a green [[Legioss]] and a blue [[Tread]] mecha too, but he is just an average pilot.

His name was changed to [b]Rand[/b] in the [[Robotech]] American adaptation of the series.

title: yf-19
body:
A transformable [[mecha]] from the [[MACROSS]] universe. It first appeared in the [[Macross Plus]] OVA. 

The [b]YF-19 Alpha One[/b] is an advanced prototype of the [[VF-19]] [[variable fighter]]. 

This new mecha was designed by [[scientist]] [[Yang Neumann]]. A test [[pilot]] for this fighter was [[Isamu Dyson]].

Features include extreme high speed and maneuverability inside an atmosphere, [[canards]] and forward sweep wings, as well as a new mini [[pin-point barrier system]] adapted for variable fighter use.

In [[real life]] the YF-19 was designed by [[Kawamori Shouji]] in the 90s.

title: short-haired_woman_(star_fox_2_prototype)
body:
One of the cut characters found in earlier [[prototype design|prototype]] versions of [[Star Fox 2]]. Went through "various iterations":[https://nintendometro.tumblr.com/post/625287951536046080/via-nintendoleaks-star-fox-2-intended-to-have], seemingly becoming the similarly cut [[Sheep Girl (star fox 2 prototype)|]].

One of the iterations would be picked up online by artists and be depicted with black skin due to the particular hairstyle used, despite the palette data suggesting otherwise, resulting in some articles exclaiming that a black woman had been planned for the game.

title: playstation_controller
body:
A [[game controller]] design released with the [[Playstation 1]] [[game console]] in 1994.

Like the [[Super Famicom]]/[[Super Nintendo]]'s controller, which it was based on, the face of the controller features a [[D-pad]] on the left, four action buttons on the right, and initially two buttons in the middle (originally a Start and  Select button). It also features two sets of shoulder buttons, unlike the SNES controllers single set, and improved the ability to use those buttons by adding hand grips.

Starting in 1997, the design incorporated a pair of analog sticks toward the center of the controller and vibration functionality, both of which have remained a common feature in later iterations of the design.

h4. See also

* [[DualShock]] - Covers: DualShock (PSOne), DualShock 2 (PS2), DualShock 3 (PS3), DualShock 4 (PS4) and visibly similar controllers Dual Analog (PSOne), Sixaxis (PS3)
* [[DualSense]] (PS5)

title: ballos
body:
[spoiler]
Ballos is the true final boss of Doukutsu Monogatari/Cave Story. He has 4 phases: one in his human form and three in his circular form. He is the creator of the Demon Crown and its curse, that of which is nullified after the events of the best ending. He is the uncle to Misery and the younger brother of Jenka. He was once kind and caring to all those around him, using his magic to the benefit of all. The king of that land grew jealous and then imprisoned Ballos, where the resulting torture push Ballos' magic to its limit. The rest is history, and Jenka was more-or-less forced to seal her brother away.
Ballos is fully aware of all of this, and desperately wants to die. Will you grant him this mercy,  [[quote_(doukutsu_monogatari)|Quote]] and [[curly_brace|Curly]]?[/spoiler]

title: kagamine_rin_(if)
body:
One alternate design by [[kei_(keigarou)|KEI]] proposed for [[Kagamine Rin]]. This version gained popularity after the success of [[Hatsune_Miku_(if)|Hatsune Miku's 'if' design]], which prompted the release and promotion of other beta designs.

Practically there's no major differences to her current design. The only significant difference is a [[alternate color|different color]] scheme which includes [[yellow eyes]], [[yellow shorts]] and a [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow]]. This along with the similarities of her [[kagamine len (if)|counterpart]], were intended to have a even stronger [i]mirror image[/i] motif.

A color-corrected version of this same design, with her final [[white bow]] and [[aqua eyes]] but retaining the yellow shorts, was the first character art of Rin revealed to the public in DTM Magazine. Posts that predate the revelation of her final design will commonly reflect these traits.

Original art: post #182359

While it debuted as a toy, it later appeared in a special crossover episode of the anime where it was driven by [[Ikari Shinji]].

Appears in the "Android Saga" of [[Dragon Ball Z]] where he goes to present time to help the Z-Fighters against the androids and [[Cell (dragon ball)|]]. Returns in the "Future Trunks Saga" of [[Dragon Ball Super]] with the menace of [[Goku Black]].

Outside of the original source material, a variant of Future Trunks known as [[trunks (future) (xeno) (dragon ball)|Trunks: Xeno]] appears as a member of the Time Patrol and as the assistant to [[Chronoa]] in [[Dragon Ball Online]], [[Dragon Ball Heroes|Heroes]] and the [[Dragon Ball Xenoverse|Xenoverse]] series of games.

title: boyshort_panties
body:
Boy short panties are a type of women's [[underwear]] that covers the hips and upper thighs, like a pair of close-fitting [[short shorts]]. They are a relatively new, but increasingly popular style of lingerie among women as a modest and comfortable alternative to conventional [[panties]] or the [[thong]]. Essentially the female version of [[boxer briefs]].

Boyshorts are commonly worn with a [[camisole]] as [[loungewear]], or with a [[sports bra]] as [[sportswear]].

h4. See also

title: shamisen_(suzumiya_haruhi)
body: A [[calico]] cat who usually accompanies [[kyon's sister|Kyon's little sister]]. The name, in turn, comes from the name of [[shamisen|the Japanese traditional three-stringed guitar-like instrument]] which is usually played with a plectrum called a [[bachi]]. Traditionally, skins for shamisens were made using dog or cat skin, with cat skin favored for finer instruments.

title: kyon
body:
Narrator and lead male character of the [[Suzumiya Haruhi no Yuuutsu]] series. An ordinary guy who unwittingly gets himself tangled up in [[Suzumiya Haruhi|Haruhi]]'s antics. Notable for his deadpan way of talking and snarky sense of humor. 'Kyon' is a nickname and his true name is never revealed. 

h4. See also

* [[Kyon's sister]]
* [[Kyonko]]

title: kyonta_(kandanchi)
body:
An [[original]] non-canon character created by [[kandanchi]] for a series of 4komas. He is the son of [[Kyon]] and [[Suzumiya Haruhi]]. He looks to have inherited some of the more whimsical qualities that [[Kyon's sister|Kyon's sister]] shows in the series. Kyonta is a nickname that his sister [[Koharu (kandanchi)|]] gave him; his real name has not yet been divulged.

title: justice_devil_(chainsaw_man)
body:
The Justice Devil is a Devil that embodies the fear of justice. They are the secondary antagonist of the War Devil arc.

This tag is used for both the the Justice Devil itself as well as humans that have been transformed into monsters by the Justice Devil's powers. The former is currently hypothetical, as the Justice Devil has yet to appear in person.

Nothing is known about the Justice Devil's personality, except that they tend to contract with anyone who sees their actions as "right" and "justifiable" (such as the [[Class President (Chainsaw Man)|]] and [spoiler][[Yuko (Chainsaw Man)|]][/spoiler]) regardless of the actual morality behind their actions.

title: rayforce
body:
[b]RayForce[/b] is a vertical-scrolling shooter game by [i]Taito[/i] released for the [i]Taito F3[/i] arcade hardware in 1994, and later ported to the [[Sega Saturn]] in 1995, [[Microsoft]] [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] in 1997, and [[iOS]] in 2012.

Due to trademark problems, when the home version was released in [[Japan]] it was renamed [b]Layer Section[/b]. Finally, when [i]Acclaim[/i] got a hold of it for the North American and European home releases, it was renamed yet again as [b]Galactic Attack[/b]. To add more confusion, the game was also titled [b]Gunlock[/b] in European arcades.

h4. See also

* [[RayStorm]] (Sequel, initially named [b]R-Gear[/b])
* [[RayCrisis]] (Prequel)

h4. External links

* "[i]RayForce[/i] on [i]Wikipedia[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RayForce

title: solitaire
body:
A card game to be played by one person, usually played with one or two decks of [[playing card]]s. Also known as [b]patience[/b] in British English.

Even though there are many such one-player card games, the term is synonymous with one such game known as Klondike, which became more popular after its inclusion (under the name Solitaire) as a standalone game in the [[Microsoft Windows]] operating systems starting with Windows 3.0.

h4. Further reading:

* "Wikipedia: Patience (game)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patience_(game)]
* "Wikipedia: Microsoft Solitaire":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Microsoft_Solitaire]

title: tears_to_tiara
body:
[b]Tears to Tiara[/b] is a Japanese adult tactical role-playing game developed by [i][[Leaf (studio)|]][/i]. It was first released for [[Microsoft Windows]] on April 28, 2005 in Japan. Then it was followed by a 12-years-old and up version released for the [[PlayStation 3]] platform on July 17, 2008 in Japan, Hong Kong, and Taiwan in which the adult content was removed. The PlayStation 3 remake titled [b]Tears to Tiara: Kakan no Daichi[/b] (ティアーズ・トゥ・ティアラ -花冠の大地-) was released on September 17, 2009 which contained several enhancements and additional scenarios including new character designs and changed the original 2D gameplay to 3D. A side story game for the PlayStation 3 remake, titled [b]Tears to Tiara Gaiden: Avalon no Nazo[/b] (ティアーズ・トゥ・ティアラ外伝 -アヴァロンの謎-) has been released on September 17, 2009. Both the remake and [b]Gaiden[/b] were also ported for [[PlayStation Portable]].
An anime adaptation aired between April 6, 2009 and September 28, 2009 based on the PlayStation 3 remake. The anime is directed by "Kobayashi Tomoki":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B0%8F%E6%9E%97%E6%99%BA%E6%A8%B9 and its series composition done by "Machida Touko":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%BE%85%E7%94%B0%E5%A0%82%E5%AD%90. The animation is done by [i]White Fox[/i] and [i]T3Works[/i] is the series' production committee.

[i](This wiki requires further expansion.)[/i]

h4. External links

* "[i]Tears to Tiara[/i] Official Website":http://leaf.aquaplus.co.jp/product/ttt/
* "[i]Tears to Tiara: Kakan no Daichi[/i] Official PS3 Site":http://aquaplus.jp/ttt/ ("PSP":http://aquaplus.jp/psp_ttt/)
* "[i]Tears to Tiara Gaiden: Avalon no Nazo[/i] Official PS3 Site":http://aquaplus.jp/t3a/ ("PSP":http://aquaplus.jp/psp_t3a/)
* "[i]Tears to Tiara[/i] at [i]Wikipedia[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tears_to_Tiara
other_names: ティアーズ・トゥ・ティアラ

title: gunstar_heroes
body:
[b][i]Gunstar Heroes[/i][/b] is a run and gun [[video game]] developed by [[Treasure (developer)]] and published by [[Sega]]. 

It was Treasure's debut game, originally released on the [[Sega Mega Drive]]/Genesis in 1993. 

The game's premise is centered around a pair of characters, [[Gunstar Red]] and [[Gunstar Blue]], in their efforts to stop an evil empire from recovering four powerful gems. The characters can fire guns and perform a series of acrobatic maneuvers to fight enemies across each stage. There are four weapons in the game which can be combined with one another to create different shot types.

Gunstar Heroes was a critical success, being praised for its frantic action and advanced graphics. It helped establish Treasure's place in the industry, and introduced several design conventions which would become characteristic of their later work such as large bosses and a unique sense of humor. 

It was re-released several times, including dedicated ports to the [[Sega Game Gear]] and [[Nintendo 3DS]], and received a sequel on the [[Game Boy Advance]]. 

Sega released a "Gunstar Heroes Treasure Box" in 2006 in Japan, a compilation of Treasure games for the [[PlayStation 2]] as part of their Sega Ages 2500 series. Included on the compilation were Gunstar Heroes, [[Dynamite Headdy]] (1994), and [[Alien Soldier]] (1995). The Japanese and international versions of each game were included, along with the Game Gear ports of Gunstar Heroes and Dynamite Headdy, and a Genesis prototype of Gunstar Heroes. It was released digitally on the PlayStation Store in 2012.

Gunstar Heroes has also been released on the [[Xbox 360]], [[PlayStation 3]], [[Wii]] and [[Microsoft Windows]]. A Sega Forever version for mobile devices was released in 2017.

It is still considered one of the best action games of the 16-bit era, and one of the best video games of all time by several publications.

title: wakamoto_tetsuko
body:
Character from [[Strike Witches Zero]].

A Flying Officer from the Fuso Imperial Navy. Student of [[Kitagou Fumika]] and friends with [[Sakamoto Mio]] and [[Takei Junko]].
She possesses a skill called "Awakening" which allows her to synchronise with her familiar much more than other witches do. This makes her hair grow longer and tremendously increases her strength and speed.

Her weapons are a Type-99 Cannon and a Kotetsu katana. Her familiar is a Fuso wolf, and she's based on Iwamoto Tetsuzou.

title: shokugeki_no_souma
body:
An ongoing 2013 cooking manga written by "Tsukuda Yuuto":[http://twitter.com/tsukudayuto] and illustrated by [[Saeki Shun]]. It was adapted into an anime for the spring 2015 anime block with a second season airing in summer 2016. A third season followed in spring 2018 and then a fourth in autumn 2019.

The story revolves around [[Yukihira Souma]], a teenage culinary prodigy sent by his father Jouichirou to Tootsuki Tea Ceremony and Culinary Institute, an elite academy with a graduation rate of 1%, where he encounters several friends and rivals, including [[Nakiri Erina]], the haughty granddaughter of the school headmaster.

title: debt_collector_(chainsaw_man)
body:
The nameless Debt Collector  is a minor but pivotal antagonist from [[Chainsaw Man]]. He is a member of the Yakuza who uses [[Denji (Chainsaw Man)|]] as a devil hunter in order to offload his debt due to his dead father unable to pay it, and is a scummy old man who sold his soul to the devil and betrayed [[Denji (Chainsaw Man)|]] just to get what he wants.

He is the grandfather of [[Katana Man (Chainsaw Man)|]].

title: hell_devil_(chainsaw_man)
body:
The Hell Devil is a devil that embodies the fear of [[Hell]].

The Hell Devil was summoned by [[Kishibe (Chainsaw Man)|]]'s 'Anti-[[Makima (Chainsaw Man)|]] Squad' after six of the Devil Hunters comprising the squad had slit their throats, right after requesting for the Hell Devil to kill [[Makima (Chainsaw Man)|]] and commend her to Hell.

[[Santa Claus (Chainsaw Man)|]] used the ability of the Hell Devil by sacrificing one of her perfect dolls and three children to take everyone in the building to Hell, which resulted in a giant hand with six fingers emerging from the sky.

title: lugh_(fire_emblem)
body:
CV: Junko Takeuchi (JP), Michael Johnston (EN)

A playable character in [[Fire Emblem: The Binding Blade]], Lugh is a mage and the son of [[Nino (Fire Emblem)|]] from [[Fire Emblem: The Blazing Blade]], alongside [[Raigh (Fire Emblem)|]], his twin brother. After being orphaned at a young age, he also befriends [[Chad (Fire Emblem)|]], a thief who is also an orphan.

He can also potentially befriend [[Elen (Fire Emblem)|]] and [[Melady (Fire Emblem)|]]. In his supports with the latter, it is revealed that Lugh carries a hatred of Bern, as they were responsible for destroying the orphanage where he was raised. He initially resents Melady because of this, after discovering she is from Bern, but they reconcile after Lugh realizes they are allies.

Appearance wise, he greatly resembles [[Merric (Fire Emblem)|]] from [[Fire Emblem: Mystery of The Emblem]], except slightly younger, with a lime outfit held together by a [[belt]], a yellow [[cape]], no [[pants]], and brown [[boots]].

h4. See Also
* [[Raigh (Fire Emblem)|]], his twin brother
* [[Chad (Fire Emblem)|]]
* [[Nino (Fire Emblem)|]], his mother from Fire Emblem: The Blazing Blade.

title: melady_(fire_emblem)
body:
CV: Ayaka Nanase (JP), Morgan Berry (EN)

A playable character from [[Fire Emblem: The Binding Blade]], Melady is a [[wyvern]] rider who serves as the retainer of Princess [[Guinevere (Fire Emblem)|]] of Bern, alongside the cleric [[Elen (Fire Emblem)|]]. Her wyvern is named [[Tryffin (Fire Emblem)|]].

She also has a younger brother, [[Zeiss (Fire Emblem)|]], and was once [[Galle (Fire Emblem)|]]'s lover, until their conflicting loyalties place them on opposite sides of the war: Melady is loyal to Guinevere, who sides with [[Roy (Fire Emblem)|]], while Galle is loyal to General [[Murdock (Fire Emblem)|]], who in turn is loyal to King [[Zephiel (Fire Emblem)|]]. She can also potentially befriend [[Lugh (Fire Emblem)|]] and [[Trec (Fire Emblem)|]] via supports.

Appearance-wise, she bears a strong resemblance to [[Minerva (Fire Emblem)|]] from [[Fire Emblem: Mystery of The Emblem]], having [[red hair|red]], [[short hair]], red [[boots]] over black [[thighhighs]], a red [[breastplate]], and a [[circlet]] around her forehead. Often depicted wielding a [[lance]], her weapon of choice.

h4. See Also
* [[Zeiss (Fire Emblem)|]], her younger brother
* [[Galle (Fire Emblem)|]], her lover
* [[Guinevere (Fire Emblem)|]], Melady’s liege
* [[Elen (Fire Emblem)|]]

title: spy_kyoushitsu
body:
A 2020-to-Present comedic adventure light novel series written by Takemachi and illustrated by [[Tomari_(veryberry00)|]]. An anime adaption by the animation studio Feel premiered in January 2023.

The story revolves around the newly formed covert team Lamplight in the Din Republic, a nation that is in a shadow war with their neighbor the Galgad Empire.  At the start of the story, Lily, a 17-year-old girl attending one of the Din Republic's covert agent training academies and who is on the verge of flunking out receives an offer to provisionally graduate by joining the newly form covert team Lamplight.  Despite the fact the team is being formed to tackle "Impossible Missions," missions with an estimated mortality rate over 90%, Lily accepts on the expectation of being supported by the best of the best agents their country has to offer.  Upon arriving at Lamplight's headquarters she learns an unfortunate truth. Team Lamplight is composed of washout teenage girls like herself and their boss/mentor Klaus completely lacks the ability to instruct them despite being the best spy their country has to offer.  To make things even worse, their first "Impossible Mission" is scheduled only a month away.  Lily ends up having to figure out how she can resolve this crisis.

h4. Characters - Team Lamplight

* [[Lily_(spy_kyoushitsu)|]]

title: raigh_(fire_emblem)
body:
CV: Natsumi Fujiwara (JP), Sam Regal (EN)

A playable character in [[Fire Emblem: The Binding Blade]], Raigh is a shaman and the twin brother of [[Lugh (Fire Emblem)|]]. He is also the son of [[Nino (Fire Emblem)|]] from [[Fire Emblem: The Blazing Blade]] alongside his brother. After being orphaned with his brother at a young age, he befriends [[Chad (Fire Emblem)|]], a thief who is also an orphan. He can also potentially befriend [[Sophia (Fire Emblem)|]] and [[Hugh (Fire Emblem)|]] via supports.

Appearance wise, he looks identical to his twin brother Lugh, but wears a different outfit: he wears a long [[black coat]] with a purple [[cape]], brown [[boots]], and a green [[banner]] down the center. [[Fire Emblem Heroes]] adds golden trim to his outfit.

h4. See Also

title: dragon_ball_minus
body:
[b]Dragon Ball Minus: The Departure of the Fated Child[/b] is a short manga story by author [[Toriyama Akira|Akira Toriyama]] published in 2014. Featured in the [[Ginga Patrol Jaco]] comic as a bonus, it occurs prior to the [[Dragon Ball]] manga/anime series events, telling how [[Son Goku]] arrived on Earth. Remarkable for being the first work to introduce the identity of Goku's mother, [[Gine]]. 

It was (mostly) adapted into animated format in the 2019 movie [[Dragon Ball Super Broly]].

title: lily_(spy_kyoushitsu)
body:
[quote][i]I’m code name Flower Garden—and it’s time to bloom out of control.[/i][/quote]

Lily is a female main character of the series [[spy_kyoushitsu|Spy Classroom]].  She is 17-years-old with medium length (platinum [[blonde hair|blonde]]) [[grey hair]] and [[red eyes]].  Her hair is typically adorn with black [[hair_ribbon|ribbons]] on each side and a [[lily (flower)|lily]] [[hair_flower|flower]] worn on her right side.

She is depicted as being overly boisterous, a klutz, and somewhat an airhead; but also very attentive at monitoring and maintaining the morale of her teammates.  Her code name is "[i]Flower Garden[/i]" (花園 [i]hanazono[/i]) and her specialty is poisons. She is member 1 of team Lamplight and serves as the team leader.

title: danuvia_43m
body:
The Danuvia 39M/43M was a [b]Hungarian [[submachine gun]][/b] designed by Pál Király in the late 1930s. It had seen major conflicts during [[World War II]] and the Hungarian Revolution. Unlike most SMGs, it fires the more-powerful, rarer [b]9×25mm Mauser[/b] [[ammunition|round]] instead of 9×19mm Parabellum. The gun was well-liked by troops it was issued to; it reportedly functioned well in the sub-zero, muddy conditions on the Eastern Front. 

h6. Variants
* [b]Géppisztoly 39/A M[/b] - Has a traditional single-piece wooden stock. 
* [b]Géppisztoly 43M[/b] - Most produced version. Has a [[folding stock|bottom-folding stock]], shortened barrel, foldable magazine well, and a pistol grip. 

h4. See also
* [[43M (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[list of weapons]]
* Wikipedia entry: "Danuvia 43M submachine gun":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Danuvia_43M_submachine_gun]

title: whimsicott
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #547 in the National PokéDex, a dual type Grass/Fairy Pokémon. Prior to Generation 6, it was a pure Grass type Pokémon.
Whimsicott is a small, brown bipedal Pokémon with a vaguely ram-like appearance. There is a cotton-like substance covering its back, neck, and forehead. Behind it is a green, star shaped section similar to the area where a plant connects to its produce. It has orange, oval-shaped eyes and green, curled horns or ears. 

It evolves from [[Cottonee]] via [i]Sun Stone[/i].
Japanese Name: [b]Elfuun[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Cottonee]]
Next Pokémon: [[Petilil]]
